name: Confidence in scientists to act in the best interests of the public, by demographic characteristics: 2020
description: Confidence in scientists to act in the best interests of the public, by demographic characteristics: 2020

creator.name: National Center for Science and Engineering Statistics

variableMeasured.name: field_level_of_confidence_in_scientists_a_great_deal
variableMeasured.description: Level Of Confidence In Scientists A Great Deal

variableMeasured.name: field_level_of_confidence_in_scientists_a_fair_amount
variableMeasured.description: Level Of Confidence In Scientists A Fair Amount

variableMeasured.name: field_level_of_confidence_in_scientists_not_too_much
variableMeasured.description: Level Of Confidence In Scientists Not Too Much

variableMeasured.name: field_level_of_confidence_in_scientists_none_at_all
variableMeasured.description: Level Of Confidence In Scientists None At All

notes: Percentages may not add to 100% because the nonresponse category for level of confidence is not shown. See Table SPPS-11 for standard errors. Responses are to the following: How much confidence, if any, do you have in [scientists] to act in the best interests of the public?
sources: Pew Research Center, American Trends Panel (2020), Wave 79, conducted 18–29 November 2020. Data were provided to the authors by the center prior to public release. Science and Engineering Indicators
